challengeName: HeavyWater Update App UI to match Design - Part 1
detailedRequirements:
Welcome to the HeavyWater Update App UI to match Design - Part 1 contest. As part of this contest, we would like you to update an existing user interface with the provided designs.

 

This contest is part of series of contests where we will take each page the user interface and update it to match the provided designs. Thus, participate early to understand the application well to be able to compete in future contests in this project.

 

Project Overview

The goal of this app is to allow consumer mortgage borrower applicants and mortgage loan officers to gather data for a mortgage application in a simple, efficient, and enjoyable manner.

This is a data gathering questionnaire app that requires zero training of users to begin using and provides a simple and enjoyable experience for the process of gathering mortgage application data.

 

Contest Overview

Check out the existing application shared in the contest forum. We will also share the designs. You are expected to go through the application and compare it with the designs and update the user interface of the application to match the design.

For this contest, page 00-2Welcome-Screen.jpg is in scope. You are expected to carry out the following changes:

- Replace Logo at the bottom. with the image which doesn't have the word  Interview Assistant - this has been shared in the contest forum
- Currently, since the app's landing page content is small and does not require the user to scroll, the web page does not cause Safari (in iPhone) or Chrome (in Android) to show the web page only with the address bar and any other toolbars hidden. Force the browsers to hide the address bar and any other toolbars and show the minimal ui. To understand the behaviour expected, go to a website like Reddit, start scrolling the app and notice how the address bar and the bottom bars hide and only shown up when the user clicks on the bottom of the screen or scrolls back to the top. We are asking for this behaviour for our app but without the need for the user to start scrolling

 

Points to Note

- Focus on carrying out the changes relevant to this contest. Do not carry out changes if they are not in the scope of this contest
- You are only expected to carry out user interface improvements. In the process, you are also expected to not break any existing functionality
- The target browsers are Safari in iPhone 5, iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus, Google Chrome in Android phones and Google Chrome for Desktop.
- Note that the app is responsive. The changes that you carry out are expected to be responsive too. There is slight difference between the Desktop and Mobile versions so kindly ensure that the changes that you carry out are applicable to both devices (wherever applicable).
finalSubmissionGuidelines: Submit only the changed files. Please do not submit the entire application. Please ensure that your changes work on the mentioned browsers and devices.
